text.tspan: This modular setup enables : Raman, PL, and absorbance measurements (reflection/
transmission) with integrated k-space analysis via a Fourier lens pair.
Flip-mounted optics allow instant switching between techniques while preserving alignment.
CW Laser – Continuous-wave laser source (e.g., 532,633,785 nm) for Raman/PL excitation
White Lamp – Broadband light source for Absorption/Transmission/Reflexion measurements
Flip Mounts are labelled with * (M*/BS*/DC*) – mirrors, dichroics and beamsplitters for rapid optical path switching
Sample Stage/Cryo – XYZ-positioned with rotation capability for k-space mapping
Fourier Lens Pair – Converts real-space signals to k-space resolution
Filter Wheel (SPF/LPF) – Interchangeable filters depending on the excitation source wavelength
Camera (probably pixis) – Real-time imaging for alignment and spatial characterization
